title: MOCK EXERCISE ON EARTHQUAKE DISASTER RESPONSE CONDUCTED SUCCESSFULLY AT SIAHA
content:
341/2025-2026

Siaha, 15th January 2026:A state-wide Mock Exercise on earthquake disaster response, organised by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), Mizoram State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA) and District Disaster Management Authorities (DDMAs) across Mizoram, was successfully conducted today at Siaha District.

The exercise was monitored from the District Emergency Operation Centre (DC Mini Conference Hall), Siaha, by the CEO, District Disaster Management Authority (DDMA), Shri Abraham Beirazi Khithie, the Additional Deputy Commissioner, and other officials through video conferencing.

In Siaha District, the simulated earthquake-related disaster sites were identified at two locations, namely:

Residential Area – New Colony–I (near Hillgate School)Bus Accident Site – New Colony (near Bus Station)

The mock earthquake scenario commenced at 10:00 AM, simulating a 7.1 magnitude earthquake originating from the Champhai District border area. The earthquake scenario included multiple disaster impacts such as building collapse, fire outbreak due to collapsed structures, people trapped under debris, and a town bus accident during transit.

At the disaster sites, Site Incident Commander (SIC), Staging Area Manager (SAM), Relief Camp Manager, and Observers were deployed. Due to the absence of mobile network connectivity, coordination was carried out through MPRO communication, and based on inputs received at the District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC), the Search & Rescue Teams comprising VDMC, Assam Rifles, Police/IR, Quick Response Team (QRT), Power & Electricity Department, Fire & Emergency Services, along with Medical Teams, were mobilized immediately.

Sequence of Events During the Mock Exercise:

1. At 10:00 AM, the Village Council (VC) / Village Disaster Management Committee (VDMC) reported the occurrence of earthquake-induced damage to the DEOC.

2.DDMA members, the Site Incident Commander, and Staging Area Manager were present at the DEOC and, upon receiving alerts, promptly deployed rescue, relief, and response personnel to the affected locations.

3. At the disaster sites, an Incident Command Post, Staging Area, and Medical Aid Post were established. A Relief Camp was also set up at a suitable nearby location, MTP Hall, for displaced persons.

4.The Medical Teams attended to the injured victims and carried out triaging based on injury severity. Those requiring further medical care were transported to hospitals using ambulances and other available vehicles. The Site Incident Commander submitted regular situation reports to the DEOC, including details on rescued persons, injured victims, hospital referrals, and other response activities. The Relief Camp Manager also reported on the number of evacuees accommodated and relief assistance provided.

5. At 5:00 PM, a simulated aftershock scenario was conducted at the residential area of New Colony–I (near Hillgate School), requiring renewed mobilization of response personnel as per assigned responsibilities. The mock exercise concluded successfully at 6:30 PM.

title: MOCK EXERCISE ON EARTHQUAKE DISASTER RESPONSE CONDUCTED SUCCESSFULLY AT LAWNGTLAI
content:
340/2025-2026

Lawngtlai, 15th January 2026:A state-wide Mock Exercise on earthquake disaster response, organised by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), Mizoram State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA) and District Disaster Management Authorities (DDMAs), was successfully conducted today at Lawngtlai District at 10:00 AM.

The mock scenario simulated a 7.1 magnitude earthquake, causing structural damage to residential buildings at Chandmary and Bazar areas of Lawngtlai, along with a bus accident. The entire exercise was monitored by Shri Donny Lalruatsanga, Deputy Commissioner, Lawngtlai, and other senior officials through the District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC).

At 10:00 AM, the DEOC received reports of building collapse and a bus accident caused by the earthquake. Upon receiving the information, the Chairman, DDMA immediately activated the Incident Response System (IRS) and sirens were sounded. The District Officer instructed all concerned departments to mobilize necessary equipment. The CEO, DM&R, directed all line departments to report to the DC Office. The SDRF was instructed to proceed to the DEOC, while Police and Traffic personnel were directed to move to the incident sites. Village Councils (VCs) and YLA volunteers were also mobilized for assistance.

The PWD and Power & Electricity Department immediately reached the affected areas and restored blocked roads and damaged power lines. The Quick Response Team (QRT), after reaching the site, reported about 20 injured persons and requested deployment of SDRF and additional rescue teams. The SDRF teams promptly arrived at the site.

The Search and Rescue Operation was led by the Operation Commander from the 3rd IR Battalion, Thingkah. While SDRF teams handled the bus accident site, QRT personnel managed the collapsed buildings. The injured were shifted to the Medical Aid Post, where Medical Teams provided First Aid and TRIAGE. Out of four critically injured victims, two were declared dead at the spot. Police personnel conducted inquest proceedings, while the remaining two critically injured persons were shifted by ambulance to the District Hospital. After completion of rescue operations, the Operation Commander reported to the Incident Commander, who in turn informed the Chairman, DDMA. The Chairman subsequently declared the operation closed.

A Mock Drill Re-enactment was conducted at 5:00 PM at the DC Office complex, demonstrating the entire sequence of response activities. At 6:40 PM, a Debriefing Session was held via Video Conference at the DC Conference Hall, attended by Heads of Line Departments, Observers and other officials.

title: State-Level Mock Exercise on Earthquake Disaster Conducted in Lunglei
content:
339/2025-2026

Lunglei, 15 January 2026:A State-Level Mock Exercise on Earthquake Disaster was successfully conducted in Lunglei today as part of a statewide initiative organised by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) in coordination with the State and District Disaster Management Authorities.

The exercise commenced at 10:00 a.m. with the activation of the disaster siren from the District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC), Lunglei, simulating an earthquake of 7.1 magnitude with its epicentre located on the northern side of Champhai district in Mizoram, India. Two locations—HPC Office, Chanmari, and the residential complex of PWD Quarters at Rahsiveng—were simulated as major incident sites to replicate earthquake-induced damage.

The drill covered evacuation, search and rescue operations, fire response, debris clearance, medical triage, and relief arrangements. The mock exercise was supervised by the Deputy Commissioner of Lunglei and Chairperson, DDMA, Pi Navneet Mann, who also acted as the Responsible Officer from the DEOC set up at the DC Conference Hall.

The Treasury Office courtyard was designated as the staging area, the Convention Centre as a relief camp, and Civil Hospital Lunglei for medical management. The entire exercise was also monitored live by State authorities through video conferencing.

Various stakeholders, including district officials, police, security forces, medical teams, Quick Response Teams (QRTs), Disaster Response Force (DRF), line departments, local volunteers, YMA members, and community leaders, actively participated, demonstrating coordinated and integrated disaster response mechanisms.

A night-time mock exercise was also scheduled at Rahsiveng to assess preparedness and response during evening hours. A debriefing session was held later through video conference, during which site incident commanders and observers presented their reports and shared suggestions for further improvement.

The DDMA Chairperson expressed appreciation to all officials, responders, volunteers, and members of the public for their cooperation and contribution in making the exercise a success.

title: AIZAWL DISTRICT-AH LIRNGHING THLEN THULHA CHETLAK DAN TUR NUNCHAN ZIRNA (MOCK EXERCISE) NEIH A NI
content:

Dated Aizawl, the 15th January, 2026:Sawrkar Laipui ruahmanna angin vawiin khan Mizoram District hrang hrangah lirnghing thlen thulha chetlak dan tur nunchan zirna (mock exercise) neih a ni a. Aizawl District-ah chuan Aizawl District Disaster Management Authority (ADDMA), Mizoram State Disaster Management Authority (MSDMA) leh National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA)-te ruahmannain zing lam chu hmun hnih – OLAS School, Tuikhuahtlang leh Lok Bhavan-ah te neih a ni a. Aizawl Hospital & Research Centre, Khatla chu Hospital atana hman niin, staging area atan Lammual Ground, relief camp atan Lok Bhavan hman a ni bawk.

Nunchan zirnaah hian Champhai hmar lamah 7.1 magnitude-a naa lir nghing anga ngaih a ni a. Zing dar 10:00-ah siren tihrik a ni a. DC Conference Hall chu District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC) atan hman niin, Er. Lalhriatpuia, Aizawl DC, Chairman, ADDMA ni bawk kaihhruaina hnuaiah ADDMA member-te'n vilin, he’ng hmuna thil thleng chanchin an la khawm a, nunchan zirna hmuna thawktu leh bungraw tul angte thawnchhuahna thupek an chhuah a. Vawiin nunchan zirnaaah hian building-te chimin, Lok Bhavan-ah kangmei a chhuak a. Electric leh communication line-te, tui pipe-te chhiain, kawngpui a khi bawk a. Thing leh electric ban tlute'n kawng a dang bawk.

Zing lam report-ah chuan mi 5-in nunna chanin, mi 44-in hliam an tuar a, hliam tuar mi 10 hospital thlenpui niin, 6 admit an ni. Relief camp-ah mi 20 dah an ni bawk. Chhun dar 1-ah DEOC-ah incident site hrang hranga duty-te fuan khawmin, Site Incident Commander leh Observer-te report hmangin thlirletna hun (debriefing) neih a ni a. Heta tang hian inzirna tur laite sawiho a ni.

Zan lamah Lok Bhavan-ah mock exercise hi neih leh tura ruahman a ni.

Vawiin nunchan zirnaah hian Aizawl Hospital, Civil Hospital Aizawl, Police, MPRO, PWD, P&E, PHED, FCS&CA, NDRF, QRT, 1st MAP (SDRF), 3rd MAP (SDRF), CDRT, Fire & Emergency Services, , Transport Dept, I&PR, Traffic, NIC, Aapda Mitra, NCC, leh Civil Aviation-te an tel a ni.

title: IOCL Extends CSR Support of Rs. 62.38 Lakhs to Zoram Medical College & Hospital
content:
338/2025-2026

Falkawn, 15th January, 2025 :An MoU (Memorandum of Understanding) was signed today between the Director, Zoram Medical College & Hospital (ZMC&H), and Mrs. Malati Makar, Senior Manager (HR–CSR), IndianOil AOD State Office, for Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) assistance from Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL).

Under this MoU, IOCL will provide CSR support amounting to Rs. 62.38 lakhs for the procurement of critical medical equipment for Zoram Medical College & Hospital, Falkawn. The assistance will be utilized for an ALS (Advanced Life Support) Ambulance, a Diathermy Machine, and C-Arm equipment, which will significantly enhance emergency response, diagnostic, and treatment capabilities of the hospital.

The Director, ZMC&H, expressed sincere appreciation to IOCL for its continued commitment to strengthening healthcare infrastructure in the region and stated that the support would greatly benefit patients and improve the quality of medical services.

Mrs. Malati Makar reiterated IndianOil’s dedication to community welfare through its CSR initiatives, emphasizing the organization’s focus on supporting healthcare and public well-being.

National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), Mizoram State Disaster Management Authority (MZSDMA) leh District Disaster Management Authority te tangkawp chuan Mizoram chhung hmun hrang hrangah lirnghing a lo thlen thulha chetlak dan tur Earthquake Mock Exercise hi vawiin chhun leh zanah an kalpui a. Hei hian Serchhip khawpui chhunga Bazar Building tichhiain mi 2 an thi a, hliam tuar 24 awmin an zinga 4 te chu na takin an hliam a, Bazar building kailawn a chhiat avangin Quick Response Team ten hliam tuar leh thi te hi hruihruala inkhai chungin an la thla a. title: STATE LEVEL MOCK EXERCISE ORGANIZED BY NDMA AND DM&R CONDUCTED IN ALL DISTRICTS OF MIZORAM
content:
337/2025-2026

Aizawl, 15th January 2026:A 'State Level Mock Exercise on Earthquake' to test disaster response and relief operations was conducted across all districts of Mizoram today. The exercise was organized by the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) and the Disaster Management & Rehabilitation (DM&R) Department. Mock scenarios involving building collapses, fire outbreaks, and various casualties caused by an earthquake were staged at 36 locations across the state. Operations at District Emergency Operation Centres, Incident Sites, Staging Areas, and Relief Camps were monitored via Video Conferencing. Brig. Ravinder Gurung (Retd.), Sr. Consultant, NDMA, monitored the proceedings from the State Emergency Operation Centre, accompanied by State Observers Pu PC Lallawmsanga, IPS (Retd.), Former Principal Secretary, DM&R, and Pu Dominic Lalhmangaiha, Former Director, DM&R.

The exercise commenced at 10:00 AM. It involved the active participation of District Quick Response Forces, Fire & Emergency Services, NDRF, SDRF, and units from Assam and Tripura including the CISF, Assam Rifles, BSF, medical teams, NGOs, and volunteers. Various line departments such as PHE, PWD, P&E, Transport, and I&PR also participated in simulating rescue and relief operations amidst collapsed buildings, fires, road blockages, and communication failures. Officials from NDMA and DM&R also visited the Relief Camps set up for the injured.

To test the efficiency of rescue and relief operations under low-light conditions, the State Level Mock Exercise will resume at 5:00 PM this evening.

title: CHIEF MINISTER AT RUBBER CULTIVATION TRAINING PROGRAMME
content:
336/2025-2026

Aizawl, 15 January 2026:The Land Resources, Soil & Water Conservation Department today organised a Training on Scientific Rubber Cultivation, Harvesting Techniques, Post Harvest Handling and Pest Management for rubber growers under the Mizoram Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission at Vanapa Hall, Aizawl. The inaugural session was attended by the Hon’ble Chief Minister of Mizoram, Shri Lalduhoma. Shri Lalthansanga, Minister for Land Resources, Soil & Water Conservation, was present as Guest of Honour, while Dr. K.C. Lalmalsawmzauva, Adviser to the Chief Minister, accompanied the Hon’ble Chief Minister.

After releasing a handbook on rubber plantation management, the Chief Minister addressed the gathering. He stated that although Mizoram attained Union Territory status more than fifty years ago, despite the people’s hard work, the State did not have a crop that could distinctly establish its identity. However, after the people’s government assumed office and implemented focused policies, Mizoram was declared the Ginger Capital of India within a short period. Passion fruit also has strong potential and is one of the most promising crops of the State.

The Chief Minister said that rubber is one of the most promising crops through which Mizoram can establish a strong identity, and with the objective of transforming Mizoram into a major rubber-producing region, the Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission was launched. The Mission was formulated after detailed consultations with the Rubber Board of India and by studying the Tripura Rubber Mission, ensuring a well-planned and systematic approach.

He noted that progress under the Mission has surpassed initial expectations, largely due to the enthusiastic response from farmers willing to take up rubber cultivation, which he described as highly encouraging. Assuring continued government support, the Chief Minister urged farmers to put in their best efforts, emphasising that rubber cultivation requires proper technical knowledge and discipline. He encouraged participants to attentively follow the training, assuring them that the government would stand by them and provide continuous support.

The training programme is being conducted with experts from the Rubber Board of India and Servo Lubricants (IOCL), who will train around 550 rubber growers on scientific cultivation practices, tapping techniques, processing of rubber sheets, post-harvest handling, and pest management.

Mizoram has approximately 50,000 hectares of land suitable for rubber cultivation. Rubber is a resilient crop that supports afforestation, aids in water conservation, offers good market value, and after its economic life, the timber can be used for furniture and other purposes. Considering these advantages, the Government of Mizoram has prioritised rubber cultivation.

The Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission was launched on 18 October 2024. Under this Mission, the Land Resources, Soil & Water Conservation Department began implementation in early 2025, and has already planted 4,50,000 rubber saplings over 1,000 hectares in Mamit and Kolasib districts. In 2026, the Department plans to plant 11,58,750 rubber saplings across 2,575 hectares in various districts. The Mission is planned for a five-year period, with a target of covering 11,500 hectares under rubber cultivation.

Infrastructure support under the Mission will include construction of approach roads to plantations, provision of rubber roller machines and tapping tools, and facilitation of marketing arrangements. During the current year, approach roads measuring 46.50 kilometres are planned for rubber plantations in eleven locations.

Similar programmes titled “Farmers Training on Scientific Rubber Cultivation, Harvesting Techniques, Post-Harvest Handling and Pest Management” will also be organised at the earliest in Lunglei, Hnahthial, Lawngtlai and Siaha districts for rubber growers.

2917/2025-2026

Aizawl the 15th January 2026:Vawiin khan Land Resources, Soil & Water Conservation Department chuan Mizoram Chief Minister's Rubber Missions hnuaia rubber chingtute tan Rubber chin dan, a seng dan leh a seng hnua a sawngbawl zui dan leh a kung enkawl dan zirna (Scientific Training) Vanapa Hall-ah a buatsaih a. Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma chuan a hawnna inkhawm telpuiin, Pu Lalthansanga, Minister chu khualzahawm a ni a, Dr. KC. Lalmalsawmzauva, Adviser to CM chuan Chief Minister hi a tawiawm.

Rubber enkawl dan lehkhabu a tlangzarh zawhah thusawiin Chief Minister chuan, UT kan nih ata kum sawmnga kan pel tawh a, loneia eizawng kan tam chungin eng thlai mah hi ka hmingthanpui ngai lo. A thlan tla nasa, a kut durh nasa te hi kan rethei em em thin. Mipui sorkar kan han ding a, kan Policy te kan han tipuitling chhova, hun reiloteah Ginger Capital of Indiaah min puang ta a ni. Sapthei pawh hi kan larpui theih, kan rama thlai tha duh tak a ni. Kan hmingthanpui theih thlai tha ber pakhat chu rubber hi a ni a. Kan ram hi Rubber tharchhuahna hmunpuia chantir tumin Chief Minister Rubber Missions kan duang chhuak ta a ni. He missions hi mawlmang takin kal kalpui lova Rubber Board of India te nena uluk taka kan sawiho hnu leh Tripura Rubber Missions kan zirchian hnua kan kalpui a ni, a ti.

A tira kan ruahman aia nasain hma kan la thung a. A chhan pawh rubber ching duh kan tam vang a ni a, thil lawmawm lam a ni. In hlawhtlin ngei theih nan sorkar chuan a tih turte a ti zel dawn a, a chingtute pawhin theihtawp in chhuah hi kan beisei che u a ni.

Ti ve mai mai tan hlawhchham theih a ni a, rubber la ching ngai lo tam takin in ching thar dawn bawk si a. A tih dan engkim hi in thiam a ngai a. He training hi tha takin in lo ngaithla dawn nia. Sorkarin in banah kan kai dawn che u a, kaihtlak ni ngei ang che u, tiin a fuih.

Pu Lalthansanga, Minister LR, S&WC pawhin thusawiin, sorkar chuan tumah thlei bik nei lovin hma a la a. Kan Chief Minister hi kuthnathawkte hmasawnna vei em em tu, amah ngei pawh huan siama hnathawk thin a ni a. Hei hi kuthnathawktuten kawng hrang hrangin an chhawr chho mek a ni, a ti.

He training-ah hian Rubber Board of India leh Servo Lubricants (IOCL) atanga mithiam lo kal ten Rubber chingtu mi 550 te hnenah Rubber chin dan leh enkawl zui dan te, Rubber hnai dan te, Rubber hnai sawngbawl dan te bakah Rubber kung tichhetu rannung laka ven dan te zirtirna an pe ang.

Mizoramah hian rubber chin theihna ram Hectares 50,000 vel a awm a, rubber hi thlai nghet, ramngaw siam thei thlai, tuihna humhalh kawnga tangkai, a hralhna tha tak, a hnai theih tawh loh hnua Thingzai atana hman zui theih ni si a nih avangin Mizoram Sorkar chuan uar zawka kalpui a tum a. Ni 18th October 2024 khan Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission a din a, he mission hnuaiah hian Land Resources, Soil and Water Conservation Department chuan kum 2025 kum tir atang khan hma la tanin, Mamit District leh Kolasib District chhunga ram 1000 hectare a zauah Rubber tiak kung 4,50,000 phun a ni tawh a, kum 2026 hian District hrang hrang pariata ram 2,575 hectare a zuavah Rubber tiak kung 11,58,750 phun chhuah leh vek tum a ni. Kum nga chhung kalpui tura duan niin, ram 11,500 hectare a zauah Rubber phun khah vek tum a ni.

Rubber chinna hmunte hi kawng sialsak an ni ang a, Rubber Roller Machine leh a hnaina hmanrua ngaihtuahsak an ni ang a, a hralhna pawh ngaihtuahpui an ni bawk ang. Kumin bikah hian rubber chinna hmun sawm leh pakhatah huan panna kawngpui kilometers 46.50 laih hman tum a ni.

“Farmers Training on Scientific Rubber Cultivation, Harvesting Techniques, Post-Harvest Handling and Pest Management” hi Lunglei, Hnahthial, Lawngtlai leh Siaha District chhunga Rubber chingtute tan hun remchang hmasa berah buatsaih leh tum a ni.

Pi R. Lalmuankimi, Secretary, Land Resources, Soil & Water Conservation chuan training hawnna inkhawm hi a kaihruai a, Rev. K. Lalthanmawia, Adviser, Mizoram Rubber Society (MIRSO) chuan hunserh a hmang a, Pu K. Hrangzuala, President, MIRSO chuan thu tawi sawiin a kaihhruaina hnuaiah rubber chingtu kal khawmten an pawisa dawn chu dik taka an hman tur thu an tiam a ni. Er. Vanlalmuanpuia Chhangte, Director, LR, S & WC chuan lawmthu sawiin a khar a ni.
